summary:
Goldberry is a character created by J.R.R. Tolkien, first seen in his 1934 poem *The Adventures of Tom Bombadil*. She is Tom Bombadil's wife, known for her golden hair and youthful looks. She plays a small part in *The Lord of the Rings*.

Scholars aren't sure where Goldberry comes from but have linked her to various characters in folklore and literature. Some believe she might be a divine being or a symbol of joy and marriage. She didn't appear in Peter Jackson's *Lord of the Rings* films but was included in other adaptations.
title: Goldberry
